Markdig supports alert blocks as documented at https://github.com/xoofx/markdig/blob/master/src/Markdig.Tests/Specs/AlertBlockSpecs.md.

Bumping markdig and adding `.UseAlertBlocks()` now renders the expected html.

Not sure how to go about adding the styles as needed.

Partial fix for #10125

* Detail 1
* Detail 2

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Version constraints in Directory.Build.targets are not considered in transitive dependencies" (#13770) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

8.0.302

### Worked before?

haven't checked

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Consider a solution with a single project `A`. Say the project has a package dependency on component `B`, and in turn, `B` has a package dependency on component `C`. Project A has (A.csproj): 
```
<PackageReference Include="B" />
```

The file `Directory.Build.targets` has
```
<PackageReference Update="B" Version="[1.0.0,)" />
<PackageReference Update="C" Version="[1.0.0,)" />
```

When `Directory.Build.targets` is changed to 
```
<PackageReference Update="B" Version="[1.1.0,)" />
<PackageReference Update="C" Version="[1.0.0,)" />
```
The new version of `B` is restored properly. Yet, when `Directory.Build.targets` is changed to 
```
<PackageReference Update="B" Version="[1.0.0,)" />
<PackageReference Update="C" Version="[1.1.0,)" />
```
The solution is NOT updating the version of referenced package `C`, keeping 1.0.0, even though that version is incompatible with the new constraint. Note that this is not a problem of conflicts between `A`, `B` and `C`, but rather that `dotnet restore` simply ignores the version of `C` when is not directly referenced by `A`.

Note also that when the package dependency on component `C` is added to project `A` (A.csproj): 
```
<PackageReference Include="B" />
<PackageReference Include="C" />
```
Then, any update of the version of `C` in `Directory.Build.targets` is taken. 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
